channel.title: [ALL READ] The IP 127.0.0.1!
channel.description:
[center]Hey guys,
Some of you know me and some of you don't. Well, im Liamsford Aka Liam. My Dad's Gf blocked the port 127.0.0.1 and now i can't play Private Servers. Could somebody post how 127.0.0.1 is not dangerious and what the IP is used for what what it does.
If this can help me PLEASE POST IT. W/o help i won't be able to play MoparScape.
Thank You,
Liamsford

item.title: [ALL READ] The IP 127.0.0.1!
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

[quote=“messing with java, post:9, topic:64959”]127.0.0.1 is the localhost network and should always be acessable…i dunno why i thaught i should just say it
you can always unblock it without them knowing??

you eat to much coffe!! gah[/quote]

If he isnt admin of his computer he doesnt have the rights to unblock stuff :0, so he has to bypass or get the admin password or again bypass the password which is easy done ;); Unless he is admin of the comp & just doesnt know how to unblock ports :|.

Read full topic

item.title: [ALL READ] The IP 127.0.0.1!
item.dc:creator: @spid3rm4n spid3rm4n
item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Sorry to hear this

Play on either 0.0.0.0 or your IP address.

If you wanna learn up on your arguement read this site, it tells what 127.0.0.1 does http://www.tech-faq.com/127.0.0.1.shtml in short it means that its a lookback to your box rather then connecting to some elses :0.

Read full topic

item.title: [ALL READ] The IP 127.0.0.1!
item.dc:creator: @BaaabyGames BaaabyGames
item.description:
@BaaabyGames wrote:

127.0.0.1

Is your home port adress without it your computer will not connect to things correctly.

127.0.0.1 is your ip and is not dangerous it belongs solely to you.

Again it is not dangerous!

Read full topic

item.title: [ALL READ] The IP 127.0.0.1!
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Maybe he wants proof to show her that that ip is good.
127.0.0.1 is your own pc’s ip adress, it meens the same as localhost. it is how you refer to your own computer from, your own computer. I dont see how it would stop you from playing on servers. try going to one of these,
*192.168.1.1
192.168.1.0
*192.168.0.1
192.168.0.0
the stared ones are ones that are most common, well in my opinion they are, from that ip you should be able to unblock it i would think.
feel free o flame me if im completly wrong or posted useless crp, but it doesnt hurt to try

Read full topic
